definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)
to lend on interest/to borrow/a loan/leniency/to make excuses/to pardon/to forgive

sentences.english: But at least their taxes will allow other people to stay in homes they can't afford.
sentences.chinese: 但至少房貸稅收會讓買不起房的那些人有房住。

sentences.english: He has fallen behind on his mortgage payment and may face foreclosure.
sentences.chinese: 他拖欠房貸付款，也許面臨銀行收房拍賣。

sentences.english: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac lost more than $30 billion combined on the securities.
sentences.chinese: 房利美和房貸美在有關證券上共損失300多億美元。

sentences.english: First, I went to bank and withdrew my monthly salary to repay my home loan.
sentences.chinese: 首先到銀行把剛發的工資取出還了這個月的住房貸款。

sentences.english: The biggest are Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.
sentences.chinese: 最大的就是房利美和房貸美。

sentences.english: But there's a mortgage and car payments as well. V: You know what?
sentences.chinese: Jane不光信用卡欠了很多錢，還有房貸和車貸。

sentences.english: We are still paying, you know, our monthly mortgage on it.
sentences.chinese: 我們每個月還在還房貸。

sentences.english: Even bad home loans in general were only part of what went wrong.
sentences.chinese: 即便是住房貸款的呆賬一般也只是出錯的一部分。

sentences.english: Banks may halt lending to third-home buyers .
sentences.chinese: 房價過高地區可以暫停發放第三套住房貸款。

sentences.english: Tuesday the Federal Reserve signaled its intention to drive mortgage interest rates lower.
sentences.chinese: 星期二，美聯儲暗示打算把房貸利率進一步降低。

sentences.english: Credit unions offer car loans, home equity loans, and other types of loans at highly competitive rates.
sentences.chinese: 合作社爲客戶提供車貸房貸和其他貸款，利率卻不高。

sentences.english: We used to think we had the best mortgage market in the world.
sentences.chinese: 我們以前常常認爲，我們擁有世界上最好的房貸市場。

sentences.english: You don't go buying a boat when you can barely pay your mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 當你只能勉強支付房貸時，不應去買遊艇。

sentences.english: Myriads of Americans are Re-Fi-Nancing their houses every day.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，每天都會有人申請住房貸款。

sentences.english: As the home-lending boom took hold, it became self-reinforcing.
sentences.chinese: 當住房貸款繁榮，事態便自我發展開來。

sentences.english: Interest paid on home loans is tax-deductible in America, encouraging people to borrow more;
sentences.chinese: 在美國，住房貸款的利息是可以減免稅的。

definition: a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
